header.name: Trillium Smith
resume: Full-stack developer with a focus on front-end experience, accessibility, and modern tooling. Builder of hands-free tools and responsive client sites, from early concept to production.
title: Software Developer

lines.text: Led front-end modernization by migrating from Create React App to Vite, reducing build times by 20% and improving developer experience through faster local feedback and leaner builds.
Co-designed and implemented a shared UI component library, standardizing accessibility and visual consistency across internal projects.
Contributed to team collaboration by introducing code quality tools (linting, reviews, shared configs) and supporting remote onboarding workflows.

Diagnosed and resolved layout, CSS, and plugin issues in custom WordPress themes inherited from prior developers, restoring site functionality and improving visual consistency for small business clients.
Addressed UX and layout issues for a legacy PHP coaching platform, improving site usability and content delivery for end users.
Built a check-in kiosk system for a live events company, streamlining attendee onboarding and reducing queue times.

text: Translated client vision into a fully responsive, production-ready website.
Collaborated closely with clients during revisions, translating feedback into precise UI changes without compromising UX or responsive behavior.
Diagnosed and restored broken inbound marketing pipelines, recovering lead flow and enabling campaign tracking.

lines.text: Built a full-stack serverless scheduling tool, with therapist-side availability controls, travel buffers, and calendar integration.
Designed around real-world constraints for solo practitioners and flexible appointment management.
Built a visualizer that converts YAML-based test cases into syntax-highlighted HTML for Cursorless, a voice-powered dev tool.
Improved contributor experience and test readability in an open source project focused on accessibility and developer ergonomics.
Presented a live demo of voice-driven development using Talon Voice and open-source tools like Cursorless. Focused on accessibility, developer ergonomics, and sustainable workflows.

coverLetter: I am excited to apply for the Software Developer position. With extensive experience in full-stack development, a strong focus on front-end technologies, and a passion for accessibility and modern tooling, I have successfully led projects from concept to production. My work at HackForLA and TS Consulting demonstrates my ability to modernize codebases, implement shared UI libraries, and improve developer workflows. I am adept at collaborating with cross-functional teams, introducing code quality tools, and supporting remote onboarding. My technical expertise spans React, Next.js, TypeScript, Node.js, AWS, and CI/CD pipelines, complemented by a commitment to building accessible and user-friendly applications. I am eager to bring my skills and enthusiasm to your team and contribute to impactful projects.

careerSummary.title: Experience
careerSummary.text: 5+ years as Software Developer with 3 small/medium companies in the Technology and Consulting industries

careerSummary.title: Skill Highlight
careerSummary.text: 5+ years building accessible, modern web applications at 3 companies across technology, consulting, and nonprofit sectors

careerSummary.title: Tools
careerSummary.text: React.js, Next.js, Vite, Tailwind CSS, Redux, Node.js, Express.js, Flask, Django, MongoDB, Git, GitHub, AWS, Docker, Figma, Postman, GitHub Copilot, Selenium, Jest, Pytest
